mentions.context: DeepBig is an extension to TransformerBig, the only difference is the former has 24 encoder layers.
DeepLarger has 20 encoder layers and its FFN dimension is 8192.

F.7 CUNI-DocTransformer (Jon et al., 2022) Exactly the same as submitted in WMT20 (Popel, 2020), document-level Transformer trained with Block Backtranslation.

It should be mentioned that the Bicleaner repository doesn't provide pre-trained classifiers for the above language pairs, consequently we trained probabilistic dictionaries in order to produce new models.

The SentencePiece module as built in the Marian toolkit is used for end-to-end text processing, without the standard pre-and postprocessing steps of truecasing, or (de)tokenization.

2) Use a noisy channel decoding reranking method (used by FacebookAI) and maybe by OnlineW since their API is way slower then G/M/A.

To complete this work, we used the following three tools:(i) MARIAN NMT (Version: v1.11.5), which was used for the training of the NMT models and (ii) Bifixer and (iii) Bicleaner, which were used in order to correct and clean the parallel training data.
we automate the data preparation pipeline using a tool named MTDATA (Gowda et al., 2021).

The four configurations are DeepBig (Xenc), DeepLarger (Xenc), DeepBigTalkingHeads (Xenc) and DeepBig (LaBSE).
Source texts for Ukrainian↔Czech and Ukrainian→English translation were selected from the inputs collected through the Charles Translator for Ukraine.
This extra data consists of about 600 segments downloaded from the web (news, example CV) and about 200 segments from the Charles Translator inputs logs.

Quality control was carried out exactly as described in last year's WMT for crowd-sourcing into-English translation assessments on Amazon Mechanical Turk (see Akhbardeh et al. (2021) for full details).

To complete this work, we used the following three tools:(i) MARIAN NMT (Version: v1.11.5), which was used for the training of the NMT models and (ii) Bifixer and (iii) Bicleaner, which were used in order to correct and clean the parallel training data.

To complete this work, we used the following three tools:(i) MARIAN NMT (Version: v1.11.5), which was used for the training of the NMT models and (ii) Bifixer and (iii) Bicleaner, which were used in order to correct and clean the parallel training data.

For each language pair, the base NMT models have been trained from raw parallel training corpora, while the additional NMT models have been trained with corpora subjected to a special cleaning process with the following tools: Bifixer and Bicleaner.

For each language pair, the base NMT models have been trained from raw parallel training corpora, while the additional NMT models have been trained with corpora subjected to a special cleaning process with the following tools: Bifixer and Bicleaner.

In this paper, we first benchmark the mainstream translators on the English-to-German task by making sure we take into account: -The changes that occurred in the WMT test sets starting 2019 -The post-processing differences between systems -The recent research in automatic metrics beyond BLEU Over the past 3 years, WMT has shown that both OnlineW and FacebookAI have a clear lead in the human evaluations.

In this paper, we first benchmark the mainstream translators on the English-to-German task by making sure we take into account: -The changes that occurred in the WMT test sets starting 2019 -The post-processing differences between systems -The recent research in automatic metrics beyond BLEU Over the past 3 years, WMT has shown that both OnlineW and FacebookAI have a clear lead in the human evaluations.
